subtitle: The inaugural issue of the New Thinking Allowed magazine
was just released on March 1st.
You can download a free PDF copy from the New Thinking Allowed
Foundation website.
That's newthinkingallowed.org.
You can even order a printed copy from nta-magazine.magcloud.com.
Thinking Allowed, conversations on the leading edge of knowledge and discovery
with psychologist Jeffrey Mishlove.
Hello and welcome. I'm Jeffrey Mishlove. Our topic today is uncanny events and my
guest is Ray Stanford. In fact, this is my fourth
interview with Ray Stanford. So, if you haven't watched
any of the earlier interviews, I'm going to link
right now to our first interview with him. It's titled The Blue Apple and it'll
be a great introduction to this video.
Ray has had an amazing career. He has made some incredible
contributions to the field of paleontology. He's been a UFO
researcher and in addition he had a former career as a trance channel and
psychic reader. He's the author of many books including
Fatima Prophecy and Socorro Saucer. He's also been featured on the
cover of the Washington Post Sunday magazine
as the Amazing Dino Man. Ray lives on the East Coast. I went to visit him
in his home to conduct this interview and now I'll
switch over to the video from our conversation.
This is an event that occurred very early on
in your life before your first marriage, if I recall correctly.
Yes, as a matter of fact, I was just getting involved and engaged with it,
my first wife, in 1969 and in July of 1969.
Well, the way things happened was what I thought would be an ordinary
Saturday morning. I awakened and I felt a strange
compulsion to do something that didn't seem rational because the
compulsion was to... I was living, of course, in San Antonio
to call a physics professor at the University of Texas, Dr. Eugene
Vasilievich, whom I had not seen in
nearly two years when I had lived in Austin.
I had met him in a medical group and
talked to him about my interest in UFOs,
aerial objects and he was very open-minded. I was pleased to see a
college professor of physics open-minded on this subject
and so I happened to mention that to him.
But that was approximately two years before what I'm going to describe
happened that Saturday morning and it really...
I mean, I just woke up in San Antonio and I had a deep
interior intense feeling that I had to call Dr. Ives, whom I hadn't
even seen in about two years. But I figured I wanted to
invite my girlfriend at the time, who became my wife, Susan,
to go to Austin with me and I wanted to add a little
incentive so I called her up and I said, hey, how would you like to go
canoeing out on... there's a place there where you could rent canoes and go out
canoeing. I forget the name of the little place.
And then we were going over to Austin. I just
feel like I've got to call a physics professor that I haven't seen in a
couple of years. It's just one of these things. I've got a
calling. So I picked her up and we went
canoeing and then we drove on to Austin and it was getting
lunchtime and we were getting hungry and so we decided to go to the Lubiz
cafeteria there in Austin where I would call Dr. Ives. So we went
there and I went to the pay phone out front and didn't have a
personal phone in those days and I called Dr. Ives's number and his
wife Edna answered and she said... I said, hi,
this is Ray Stanford. I'm not sure he remembers me but he
probably remembers me from around two years ago when I was here in Austin
and attending the same study group as you and
Jean were doing. And she said, Ray, this is amazing that you called
this morning. And I said, why is it amazing? And she said, well, because
in this morning's paper, the Austin American Statesman,
there's an article about a strange object that fell
at hypersonic speed and made a crater in a backyard of a man in San
Antonio. And he was scientifically curious and
so he took it over to the Department of Economic Geology
here at UT and to have it take a look at.
He said, but Jean wants to talk to you about it.
Knows more about it. And so he got on the phone.
He said, Ray, I wish I could understand why you called me because I'd said,
oh my gosh, if there was just some way I could contact Ray Stanford
to tell him about this, I know he's going to be interested.
And indeed, so he was right. So he came over to the cafeteria and brought me the
clipping, which you will see, which we'll be
showing. And it was from that very morning
in August of 1969. And so
I was just thrilled to have it. I could hardly wait to try to get in contact
with the professor at the University of
Texas that was involved in this. And actually, there was a photograph
in the article on the American statement that showed two professors at the
University of Texas in that department. And they were both
curious. And so when I finally
contacted the scientist involved, I called him.
And I guess it was a Saturday. I think I waited till
Monday because, if you call him, at the university.
And I said, I'm really fascinated by this.
Can I come over and talk to you about it? See how you feel about it.
So on and so forth. I don't know what analysis you might or might not have
done. But he said, sure, sure. And so I
came over there. And they were extremely gracious and
nice. And even though, obviously, I'm not a meteorologist,
I'm not an expert in meteorites. I am more now because my wife and I have
gotten a big time in collecting them and studying them.
But I wasn't then very much aware of it. I was interested that I was there.
And he said that this is also very strange because
it's not a meteorite. But clearly it fell and shows
a blazing feature from passing through the atmosphere and melt occurring
from passing through the atmosphere. And what's more,
it knocked the man in whose yard it fell. It was hanging out clothes across the
yard. He grabbed onto another clothesline to keep himself from being
thrown into the ground by the shockwave. And he just said he describes a
big crater around it which wouldn't be made by
the object. The object was only about so big.
But it would be the hypersonic shockwave compression
in front of it that excavated the crater. And
so he said, you know, we can't imagine what this is.
It's just very strange. And it definitely is not
not a meteorite in any sense of anything we've ever seen
on space. But it definitely fell at hypersonic speed.
So I'm sure that he would feel very okay if he contacted the man in his yard.
And by that time I think he already had it back in his
possession. But the second time when I visited the
professor involved, he said, by the way, something odd
happened. He said that we didn't know this till after
the thing had been taken. But where it is said here in the metal
desk drawer, but he said it had, out of matrix of this, it had broken
due to various factors, not only hitting the ground, but
maybe, well, no, I don't think he, what happened when it fell,
pieces of it flew off. And this material is primarily
glass. And glass, and it's translucent to transparent glass.
And it absorbs heat readily. So when it hit, it is, it was white hot.
And the thing is, it, but when it hit, hot
little pieces of it broke off and flew over in
outside the crater. It hit that hard into the dry grass and the grass started
burning. So T.H. Tanner, the man in whose yard it
fell, went around the front and got the hose
and connected back to the water and
squirted the grass to cut the grass up. And
but fortunately, the engineer who lived behind
Tanner, who was scientifically minded, saw that these pieces that fell off,
that Tanner wasn't paying any attention to
these little pieces. So he collected them and he gave them all
to me. He said, since you're investigating it,
he said, I think you'd like to have them, which I'm deeply appreciative.
And of course, I already showed you some of them.
But what I'm going to mention is... With the fact that your girlfriend's
father knew Mr. Tanner. As it turns out, Tanner owned a company that was
commercial air conditioning outfit. It builds the big systems that go in
tops of houses, many buildings, and commercial air conditioning.
And it so happens that the girl that I suddenly married,
who went to San Antonio with me, her father
owned an identical company, commercial air conditioning.
And when I got over there and was telling him and his wife,
and Susan already knew about it, about this, he said, well, let me tell you
something. You can believe this man. He said, he's
the most honest businessman that I know of in San Antonio. He said,
you know, as I've told you, we're in the same business.
He said, and I've known him to lose contract after contract because of his
honesty. I'm not, I don't know what I was saying
about my future stepfather, but saying I guess he was less honest
than J. H. Tanner, but he was being honest about that.
And he said, really, he said, you don't know how many times,
I mean, I beat him out of the contract because
of my honesty and because of his honesty. And he said,
really, he said, this man, he said, I would trust him with anything he told me
because he's that good a man. And so that impressed me. And I have no
doubt about that, having met and talked with him
and Tanner and his wife, that indeed they're really good people. And he's just
as honest as he could be. Anyway, I interviewed
the next door neighbors. They had been inside their house, but they
heard the sonic boom and they came down and
they ran outside. And here is this crater that hadn't been there a little while
more when they were outside. And here is this object about this size,
glowing white hot in the middle of the crater.
And Tanner's frantic and running around cutting off the
stuffing, the flame, the burn in the grass of his yard because it was a
summer. This was after all, July 28th.
And it had been very dry and hot there. And
his grass was burning in his yard, so he was putting it out.
And this is important. He had squirted down to some extent
the area around the crater. A lot of the water had drained into the
six and a half, eight or seven foot crater. And
he was sitting there. He said it was just after 10 o'clock tonight.
He was getting ready to go to bed. This had fallen in daylight. But
oh, and what I didn't mention, when it fell, he had been out in the backyard
hanging out clothes on a clothesline. And when it fell, the shockwave hit him
and knocked him across the yard. He managed to reach up and at the last
clothesline, he managed to grab where he said he would have been bone
flat in his face. But at that point, he said he was back
in the house and was just getting ready to go to bed.
And it was just after 10 o'clock in the night now.
And he looked out there. He had a back porch light
that turned on. And it was on and he could see the crater and
the whole area of the thing. The thing was still sitting in the crater.
I mean, he didn't even, of course, it had been quite hot.
When he looked out at after 10 o'clock, this thing, this
glass object was so hot that steam from the water that had drained
from around the grass in the yard that he had
turned on the fire had gotten near it. And steam was coming up
around it from the water, from radiation,
all those hours after the fall. And this is amazing.
But it's very surprising, not surprising, because
even ordinary glass, I mean, if you heat it up to white hot, where
it's been to, where the surface has been melting in the time it's passing
through the atmosphere, ablating, you're going to, and you can set it
there, it'll radiate heat for a long, long time.
So you're talking about heat radiation, not radioactivity.
Oh, no, not radioactivity, just plain thermal radiation.
And it absorbed. And, of course, there's ample,
as you see on the surface of this, you see the melts
and the flows as this thing passes through the atmosphere,
it's going to be tilting and moving, and yet its surface
is liquid. The surface part has gotten so hot, white hot,
that the outer part of it is actually liquid glass.
And you can see all over the surface where the various pressures, and as it
turned its way, the glass flowed different ways and
places. And, of course, there's tremendous
pressure, it's under, I mean, it's hypersonic speed.
When you fall at cosmic velocity, I mean, you're
not just, I mean, you're hypersonic, and it's just really
heating things up. Meteorites all have a fusion crust on them when they fall,
but they're less likely to melt than this, because this glass is just
absorbing heat, it's drinking in heat, so to speak, and
then it's also re-radiating it, and the surface is, of course, going to be the
hottest area. But that was basically
what I was forgetting and remembering, was how the steam was coming up
after 10 o'clock at night, that is just a gauge to show
how incredibly hot this was, and as we also have,
as you've seen, we have the clouds that had been
knocked up by the hypersonic shockwave, the ones that were near the object,
it was so hot that across the air, which is a pretty good insulator,
you saw the surface of the dirt, the clouds turned to glass.
I mean, there's beads of glass from the heat radiating.
I mean, this was absolute proof that this thing had been
in deep space, in the kind, of course,
that an asteroid would be in, for example, and
interacting with Earth with that kind of velocity
to heat it up. But this has more capacity than any of the meteorites that have
ever been found, simply because it's translucent and
transparent, and it's absorbing this, as I use the term,
drinking it in as it fell.
Yeah. How many days did it take from the time you
talked to the professors in Austin until you met Mr. Tanner?
Oh, immediately, I gave him a call, and he invited me to come over
and to see it. Now, when I saw this, I mean, this was as soon as I could get
there, because I knew this had appeared in the paper
that Saturday morning. So, I probably called him that
afternoon, after I got home late afternoon,
right to San Antonio. And, of course, he lived in San Antonio.
He said, you can come over and see it, it's okay.
But the thing is that I was concerned that it appeared in the
paper, and I knew since just seeing the picture
of it and talking with the professor, as he told me, it's not a meteorite, we
don't know what it is. I said, to me, the intelligence community
justifiably has to be interested in this, because
being glass, and he said it, mainly glass, but it has some copper.
He said, you know, it's mysterious. And so, I can understand when the
intelligence community sees the Austin American Statement that
Saturday morning, they say, wait a minute, we've got to get
this thing. So, sure enough, anyway, I visited Tanner right away,
and I said, look, you're going to be contacted by the
intelligence community, I'm confident. I said, they feel they need to
have this. It may be related to an ET technology,
since it's not a meteorite, it could be technology. And so, be
cautious. You had already, by this time, this is like five years after you did
the Socorro investigation, so you knew quite a
bit about these things. Yes, yes. So, I cautioned, he always went
by the name T.H. I don't know what the T or the H stood for, his last name was
Tanner, but he was just called T.H. by his wife
and everybody else. And so, I said, look, just be very
cautious. Use your discretion of what you should
do, but they're going to want this. He said,
thank you, I appreciate you're alerting me.
Okay. The very next day, two people from government intelligence
showed up at his place, his air conditioning,
his commercial air conditioning business, and
asked to talk to him and got in. And the first thing they said to him is,
Mr. Tanner, we did a background check on you before we came, and you are,
you are, we know that you're a, you love your
country, you're a patriotic man, and what we want to tell you is that
your country needs this, and we want to ask you to turn it over to
us. And he said, and I love it the way he
said it. He said, look, the way I got it figured,
this thing fell in my backyard. If the good Lord wanted you to have it,
he'd make it fall down in the middle of the Pentagon.
Of course, I don't think they had too good an answer for that,
but I thought that was pretty, pretty sharp.
And he said, but we need, we have to take this,
because it is important. And he said, well, I'm not going to give it
to you. It's not for sale, I'm not going to give
it to you. That's it. They said, well, well, we're
going to, we're going to give, we have to have it,
and, and we will, we will, we'll have to, we'll have to take this.
So we're sorry you're not willing to cooperate now, but
but you'll be hearing about it, we have to take this. And
so, indeed, they tried. Here's what happened.
I warned him. I said, you want to be cautious, because
this is probably important enough that they would be willing to break into your
place of business or into your home to get this. Well, he
took it home, and, but I told him, I said, don't leave
it there. You're going to be gone even several hours. They're likely to
know you're going to be gone, maybe monitoring your telephone,
but they're going to get him to try to get this. Well, what he did
is, they had to go somewhere that day, both he and his wife were going to be
gone for several hours. He took it one block down to
where his son and her, and his wife lived, and he, he left it
at their place, fortunately. Well, when they got back, were they
shocked. I mean, they were really appalled.
Intelligence, I don't know if it's one or two people, but it's probably two the
way things were. He said every drawer of that house had
been opened, and many of them had the contents of the
drawers thrown out on the bed or the floor.
He said they were shocked. He said clearly
they were looking for this and never found it, but everything, he said,
we, they had three color TVs, and they were brand new units.
He said nothing was stolen, not the TVs, not anything.
Somebody was looking for what I call the space material.
I'll mention here at this point that this man and his wife
called it our moon rock. Now, the reason they did is because if you check the
time of this, if I'm not mistaken, wasn't this the time
of the first lunar mission, and landing, and it had just taken off
from the moon and returned to earth, and they felt somehow that this
craft in taking off must have knocked this thing up,
and it had fallen in their yard, so they called it their
their moon rock. They were serious. They thought it might well be
a result of the Apollo mission, which I'm certain
it was not. They've not found any glass like this on the moon, not only that, but
there's pure copper in this at places, and
that hasn't been found either on the moon, but
anyhow, at this point, you can imagine how upset
he was, and he decided to be hyper-cautious about
not letting this get stolen. Well, not too long after that,
a man claiming to be from a corporation in Houston, of course, it's
very near the manned space flight center, but
I know there may or may not have been a connection, but this man claimed, and he
and he said, I'm personally interested in this, and I'd
like to buy this thing that fell from you,
and was this the one that offered
$11,000? Yes, he offered him $11,000 for this
on the spot, and he said, I'm not selling it.
This fell in my backyard, and it's not for sale,
and so anyway, the guy left, and there, I forget what other
things happened, there were several things happened in the state, they were
very much after this. The question we have to ask
yourself, why was it important? In the first place,
even back in that early stage of the space program,
I feel pretty confident that this thing, at least in its
luminous phase, as it entered the upper atmosphere,
was seen and tracked, and they knew that it was cosmic, that it had been on
its speed, and its course would indicate it was in cosmic velocity,
and it probably indicated, based on things what I now know, that it was in
orbit in the solar system, which I'll go into
that in a minute. So let me tell you what we decided,
what happened subsequently. I said, so now you're not
interested in selling it, what are you going to do with this, TH?
And I had in my hand the piece I showed you that is
211 point something grams, about a half a pound,
beautiful, marvelous specimen. I mean, it
constituted possibly, you know, 20%, 25% of the whole
specimen, maybe a little more, it's hard to say how big it was, I don't, I
haven't held the whole specimen, I haven't even seen it in a long time,
but I said, what are you going to do with this, TH?
And he says, I was going to give it to you.
I said, well, thank you. I mean, the guy would probably have paid
him $11,000 just for this, you know, but he gave it to me, and you can't
imagine how thrilled Ray Sanford was. I mean, I was just ecstatic
to get this amazing thing, and it has places in it, pure copper,
it's not oxidized copper, there are places where it's interacted
with something, possibly when they pass through the atmosphere,
where you'll see a blue-green color of a copper compound,
but only in those kind of places. Other places, it's pure copper. Well, we
wondered, what about this? Well, Cleo, who I had met at a
metaphysical study group, they had learned about my psychic work
at that time, and these days, of course, I'm not into
that, and giving psychic readings, anything
like that, but at that time, I was. I said, well,
let's see, you know, maybe my unconscious knows
something my conscious doesn't know. We, by suggestion, maybe we can get it to
give us some information, some useful information,
interesting information, at least. And so they asked just outright,
what is this? Where did it come from? It doesn't look like a meteorite.
And my source, which claimed to be the unconscious
of Ray Stanford in contact with areas of information or individuals
toward which it is directed by suggestion. Now, whether that's true or
not, I don't know. I don't make any claims
about that, but what it said was quite interesting.
It claimed that this object was actually part of what he said.
It said, the voice said, I don't know that he gave identity as an
individual, I think it was just my unconscious, yes.
It said, this was, this is part of what you would call a space city.
It was an object that had been manufactured in space,
inside of it, that there was activity, and it was 30 miles,
of your miles in diameter, 30 miles in diameter, and the outside
that there had been a matrix of copper used,
because, I guess, because it was the easy electrically conductive metal
available from whatever amazing source of copper they might have had,
which is hard to believe, but it stated that it,
they created a magnet, that they created a
silica, I guess, electrified silica vapor,
it may be a silica plasma, I don't know if that's the right term,
but it claimed that this was then condensed based on the current that was
apparently put through certain copper areas of it, and this sounds like pure
fiction, but that it condensed into this thick
outer layer that would protect from small cosmic
debris and radiations and things like this,
but that it was, the inside of it, you know, well the outside of it is that it
was around 30 miles in diameter, so we didn't know whether it's true or
not, and so somebody said, is there, is there anything you could tell us
that would, that would confirm this, or you know, that
would give us some additional evidence, and my
unconscious said, yes, it said on this date, it gave a date,
and it said to go out, it told the time to go out,
here's what it said, it said when the, here's what happened,
this thing, it said, had what, it said what today we would call
a computer error, and it did something wrong,
and it disintegrated in space, this whole 30 mile
in diameter space city, imagine the destruction, the
destruction of life, whatever these aliens might have been, and
they might have looked, but anyway, it stated that it disintegrated and
scattered over a considerable area in the solar system, a huge area,
but there's a concentration of it, and certainly,
and that it's in orbit around the sun, and it said if you will go out at that
time, it will fall on the same orbit as it did
when it originally fell, from the east to the west, you'll see it
falling from the east to the west, and it will be, as this object was,
white hot, with a few places that will be green,
because of the melting and disintegration of the copper,
and so my wonderful future was, at that time, I think,
maybe we already got married, I'm not sure,
but future mother-in-law, Cleo, she said gee, let's go,
so when the day came, she and Susan, my wife-to-be or wife,
we went out, just the three of us, and out where it was really dark
outside of San Antonio, and so help me God,
at the exact time that we were given, we were given an approximate time,
so I said it's very, you know, it's orbit, and so and so,
we can't say exactly to the second when this will happen, but
it will happen at this time, and we're standing out there waiting,
and it happened, and this was not any already little
bright meteor you see stick to the sky, oh no,
this thing was larger than the full moon, which covers a half degree of
arc approximately in the sky when you see the full moon in the sky,
and this is larger than that, maybe because it was so bright,
it was pure white with spots of green copper
burning at places, and it was hypersonic, for sure, it was moving like a bat out of
hell, and came right across from the east
exactly as it had, except it didn't fall there, unfortunately,
in San Antonio where we were, it went right over us heading west, I
wish I knew where it fell out there, I wish I had the coordinates, and we could
do a calculation, and go out and find it even to this day, possibly, if it fell in
the wilderness, but anyhow, we took that as
absolute confirmation that this thing, that at least the source is right about
this thing being in orbit, because it had to be,
because you don't go out and see, I mean,
the exact coordinate was given, the trajectory,
the appearance of it, all of it was given us in a reading.
Well, that's another example of your unconscious mind being
100% accurate. Well, that's right, I don't know if it's 100%, but it was pretty
accurate, we were happy with the accuracy. With
regard to the time and date. Right, that's right, that was right on,
I mean, it's absolutely amazing, and we didn't have
long to wait, I mean, we were delighted and thrilled.
By the way, mentioning this, that I wish I knew where this had fallen,
well, I found out that more of it had fallen in San Antonio.
Now, this is the thing, maybe this was unconscious psi,
maybe unconscious ESP, to be at the right time at the right place, as I
often am, but I happened to have some occasion to
go into a convenience store, I think it was a 7-Eleven,
possibly, in somewhere there in San Antonio,
and I was walking back to try to find out what I came after,
and here came a man, by the way, I didn't mention that Tanner
was African-American descent, and he had rather dark skin,
well, here came a man down the aisle, a nice looking
man, he was pretty tall, I think he was probably just over six feet or there
about, and I'm shorter than that considerably, and
he came down the aisle, but what got to me was not the man,
he had a gold chain around his neck, and at the end of that gold chain on his
chest was a piece of the space material, exactly,
you know, like the stuff that I had, I knew it had to be, man,
you probably, my eyes were as big as there's a ball of fire
at that time, man, and I said, pardon me, sir,
but I said, I have a question, that I am, I have a scientific
interest, that object on this chain,
I said, where did you get that, he said, well, you may not believe me,
but it fell out of the sky, I said, did it fall out of the sky on
July 28th, and he said, yes, sir, it did, how do you
know, and I said, because I'm studying another case where it fell
in southeastern San Antonio, and that was the date it fell, he said,
that's exactly when it fell, and it fell in my yard, and he said,
so I felt it was mine, I guess like Tanner, he felt that was his, and wasn't
going to give it up easily, and he said, I feel it's very
important, he said, I don't know what it is,
but it's very important, I don't know if he thought of it as a moon rock
as they did, but now to the rest of the sad story.
Well, wait, before we move forward, or maybe you were going to go there next,
Tanner did have another episode of the rock
being stolen. Yes, yeah, this is what happened,
they decided to go to Lake Tahoe on vacation,
and so he said, well, look, we obviously, they're going to try to
steal this, so let's hide it, well, instead of taking it down to his
his son's house down a block down, they decided, he said, well, look,
nobody's going to find it, they went to the dirtiest place they
could put it, near the kitchen where the cabinets
were, and there was all kind of junk
polished down, and just the upper level of the cabinet, when you open it up, right
on the floor, you're sitting right on the floor and stuff, and not, you don't put
dishes, clean dishes, you're going to use anything like that there,
so they, he pulled all the stuff out and put it against the wall at the back, as
far back as you could in there, and then put all this
junk in front of it, it's going to be safe there,
so they went to Lake Tahoe, they were gone, I remember,
they were at least a week, I don't know how long total they were gone,
it wasn't too much longer than that, I don't think, when they came back,
they didn't happen to think they'd had a nice vacation, at first they didn't
think about where is the moon rock, as they called it, but
then when his wife loved to play the piano,
